conclusion: Analyze forces acting on sphere A to find relationship between q and d
Sphere A is on inclined plane, sphere B is to the right, both at same height, separated by distance d
Identify forces: gravitational force (Fg), electrostatic force (Fe), tension (T)
Gravitational force acts downward with component along inclined plane
Electrostatic force acts horizontally due to charge repulsion
Resolve gravitational force into components: mg sin θ along inclined plane, mg cos θ perpendicular
Electrostatic force given by Coulomb's law: Fe = kq^2/d^2
Electrostatic force acts horizontally to the right
Equilibrium condition: net force along inclined plane must be zero
Horizontal component of gravitational force must balance electrostatic force
Set up equilibrium equation: mg sin θ = kq^2/d^2
Solve for q/d: q^2/d^2 = mg sin θ/k
Take square root of both sides to find q/d
Final answer: q/d = sqrt(mg sin θ/k)
